org.apache.plc4x.java.opm

Class PlcEntityManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.plc4x.java.opm.PlcEntityManager

  • public class PlcEntityManager
extends Object
    Plc4x equivalent of Jpas EntityManager for implementing Object-Plc-Mapping. This means that calls to a plc can be done by using plain POJOs with Annotations.

    First, the necessary annotations are PlcEntity and PlcField. For a class to be usable as PlcEntity it needs

    • be non-final (as proxiing has to be used in case of connect(Class)
    • a public no args constructor for instanciation
    • Needs to be annotated with PlcEntity and has a valid value which is the connection string

    Basically, the PlcEntityManager has to operation "modes" represented by the methods read(Class) and connect(Class).

    For a field to get Values from the Plc Injected it needs to be annotated with the PlcField annotation. The value has to be the plc fields string (which is inserted in the PlcReadRequest). The connection string is taken from the value of the PlcEntity annotation on the class.

    The read(Class) method has no direkt equivalent in JPA (as far as I know) as it only returns a "detached" entity. This means it fetches all values from the plc that are annotated wiht the PlcField annotations.

    The connect(Class) method is more JPA-like as it returns a "connected" entity. This means, that each time one of the getters on the returned entity is called a call is made to the plc (and the field value is changed for this specific field). Furthermore, if a method which is no getter is called, then all PlcFields are refreshed before doing the call. Thus, all operations on fields that are annotated with PlcField are always done against the "live" values from the PLC.

    // TODO Add detach method

      • connect

        public <T> T connect(Class<T> clazz)
              throws OPMException
        Returns a connected proxy.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        clazz - clazz to be connected.
        Returns:
        a connected entity.
        Throws:

      • intercept

        @RuntimeType
public Object intercept(@This
                                     Object o,
                                     @Origin
                                     Method m,
                                     @SuperCall
                                     Callable<?> c,
                                     @Super
                                     Object that)
                              throws OPMException
        Basic Intersector for all methods on the proxy object. It checks if the invoked method is a getter and if so, only retrieves the requested field, forwarding to the fetchValueForGetter(Object, Method) method.

        If the field is no getter, then all fields are refreshed by calling refetchAllFields(Object) and then, the method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        o - Object to intercept
        m - Method that was intercepted
        c - Callable to call the method after fetching the values
        that - Reference to the proxy object
        Returns:
        possible result of the original methods invocation
        Throws:
        OPMException - Problems with plc / proxying
